style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. Malt flavor and aroma are medium. This is a light-medium to medium-bodied beer. Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday - Thursday : 11:30AM-1:00AM
Friday 11:30AM-2:00AM
Saturday Noon-2:00AM
Sunday Noon to 1:00 AM

data.name: Big Claw Pilsner
data.description: Big Claw Pilsner is hand crafted in Portland, Maine to be the perfect complement to our local seafood, a delicious refresher after a long day on the slopes, or an easy way to relax after a beautiful day on the water.In keeping with brewing traditions of the past, we use two-row European barley, Czech Saaz hops and our house lager yeast to produce this premium original recipe. The crisp, clean maltiness combines with the earthy spice of noble hopss to produce a smooth, golden lager.We hope you enjoy our version of this European Classic.

breweries.name: Bull Jagger Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Focusing on one primary perfect lager, Bull Jagger Brewing Company opened its doors in the Riverside Industrial Park in 2011. Brewmaster Tom Bull holds decades of experience in the local brewing trades and partner Allan Jagger brings talent backed by a history of successful business dealings.

Found at many select fine craft beer stores, bars, pubs and restaurants in northern New England.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Please Call

data.name: Bill'sner Pils
data.description: Cool, crisp and refreshing, a great pilsner is a delicate drink and not easy to make!  Named for long-time Hale's employee, Bill Preib.  Straw in color and true to the pilsner style-- clean, light, crisp, finishing dry.  Made with Czech pilsner yeast and 100% Heidelberg pilsner malt.  Hale's is the only brewery in the region using Heidelberg pilsner malt for a production beer!  Hopped with Czech Saaz and American Tahoma.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener

breweries.name: Hales Ales Brewery and Pub
breweries.description:
Founded by Mike Hale in 1983, Hale's Ales is the Northwest's 3rd oldest and longest running independently owned brewery in the Northwest. Hale's built its long standing reputation by brewing small batch, full flavored ales using traditional English brewing methods.

An innovator from the start, Hale's was the first craft brewery to introduce Seasonal, Cask Conditioned and Nitrogen Conditioned ales to the region. Hale's goal is to stay true to what the craft brewing "revolution" is all about: crafting fresh, locally brewed ales of the very finest quality. Cheers from Hale's Ales!

breweries.name: The Knuckle Brewing Company
breweries.description: The first and only brewpub in legendary downtown Sturgis, SD. We opened our doors in July 2014 and are open 7 days a week. We are brewing on a 10 BBL system and distribute kegs throughout SD. We offer 5 year round beers as well as several rotating selections. The kitchen is open thru lunch and dinner and serves up some great food.

breweries.name: Lost Rhino Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Lost Rhino™ is a new craft brewery in Ashburn, VA with deep roots in Loudoun County. Brewers Matt Hagerman and Favio Garcia, formerly of Old Dominion, are back together and now creating some of the finest beers found in the local area!

The name Lost Rhino™ represents the strength and attitude of the rhinoceros. The five species of rhino each has its own distinct persona, ranging from laid back to aggressive. Our brews will also span a range of personalities from hoppy Pilsners to rich, malty IPAs.

"Rhino chasers" are big wave surfers on a continuous journey to find the next perfect wave. At Lost Rhino™, we are on a similar journey to create a continuing line of distinctive, enjoyable, memorable beers.

breweries.description: We are committed to producing excellent quality craft beer as well as providing interesting historical narratives to augment your tasting experience.  We have three screens with a Direct TV sports package for all the games and we are open for Monday night football with great food and $4.00 Imperial pints.

data.name: Boater Beer Pilsner
data.description: The perfect Pilsner-light, crisp, & delicious. Boater Beer is made with enough maltiness for a solid initial mouthfeel but a crisp finish.  This beer is lightly hopped to give it a nice summery floral hoppiness.  Light straw colored yellow, ABV 4.5%, and minimal IBUs.

breweries.name: Eddyline Restaurant and Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Eddyline Brewery has been brewing in the heart of Collegiate Peaks in Buena Vista, Colorado since 2009.

All beer are brewed with inspiration from our wild surroundings. Crank Yanker IPA is the best beer for cruising single track all over the valley. River Runners Pale Ale is the greatest all day suds sipper on the river and beyond. Come visit and have a great time in the Colorado Wilderness!

data.name: Brau Pils
data.description: Brau Pils is a straight forward Pilsner with a light body, moderate carbonation and an assertive yet restrained hop character. Aromas of earthy, spicy noble hops are chased by a rich, cracker-like note backed up with clean, malty notes and a neutral lager yeast profile. This beer is made to help refresh on those hot summer dog days of DC.

breweries.name: DC Brau Brewing Company
breweries.description: The fact that D.C. has become a world-class beer town is undeniable. The choices available to the local beer nerdery are staggering and ever expanding. The neighborhood corner stores continue to add microbrews to their stock and it seems that a dynamite draft selection is essential to any new bar that opens. Restaurants regularly hold beer dinners featuring multi-course food and beer pairings and for seven days in the spring, during DC Beer Week, the number of beer-themed events can make the head spin. At a handful of downtown brewpubs the beer enthusiast can sample a variety of house made brews. What D.C. has not had in over 60 years, however, is a brewery whose product is available in local stores and on tap outside of its site of production.

data.description: The brewery is a Gold Light Current News pale beer with a well-tuned malt and hops aroma. Its subtle bitterness is characteristic of the mild, aromatic and fresh taste. 11.5% P.

breweries.name: Lakefront Brewery
breweries.description: Milwaukee’s own Lakefront Brewery Inc. started in 1987.  The industrious and inventive microbrewery located on the Milwaukee River has become a Milwaukee landmark.  Its rich history includes partnerships with local taverns, preservation of local historical pieces, unique tours, family style dining options and most importantly, great beer.

breweries.name: Blue Point Brewing
breweries.description:
Starting out in 1998 as two guys with a dog, a van, and a dream, Blue Point Brewing Company quickly became one of the nation’s premier microbreweries. After first launching our lightly toasted, complex, full-flavored Toasted Lager, we rapidly gained the respect of beer lovers far and wide. Soon after, we introduced several other brews and were being compared to breweries from noted craft-brewing capitals like Denver, Boston, Portland, and Seattle.

Brewing isn’t just our business, it’s our passion. We’re beer people. We started Blue Point Brewing Company because we wanted to make beer we would drink. To quench that desire, we select only top-quality ingredients and brew all-natural, unpasteurized beer. It’s this approach that put us on the world beer map. From the World Beer Cup to the Great American Beer Festival and the Australian International Beer Awards – we’re becoming noticed the world over. But we believe you should be the judge. Let us know what you think.

Thursday and Friday 3-7pm
Saturday 12-7pm

data.name: Bubba
data.description: Large but simple, obnoxious but very likable, unfiltered...Bubba. A big American version of the classic Pilsner style. A simple malt bill is complimented by a ridiculous amount (nine additions...nonuple hopped brewed??) of flavorful American hops. A golden straw colored beer encompassing a huge hop aroma and flavor profile. All the qualities of a clean/crisp pils with lots of citrus and floral flavors.

breweries.name: Good People Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Like most real brewers, Good People started out with humble beginnings and no intention of ever starting a business. A labor of love in which long brew days in the garage, bad equipment, curious dogs (we still blame them for a bad batch or two) and hanging out with friends became commonplace. Once it took root, this hobby turned into a passion (along with some really solid beers).

We took our wares to football games, parties, and cookouts. Before too long, folks began requesting our beer. It’s pretty fun to have someone you don’t even know walk right smack dab up to you and tell you how much they like your beer. We didn’t set out to start a business, the business just found us. 

“Once in a while you get shown the light in the strangest of places if you look at it right” Robert Hunter

We wanted to brew our beer and create something that would make our families, friends, community, and ourselves proud in what we were doing. We wanted to give back and help support those that helped support us.  We wanted to represent the unique qualities of the South that make us proud to be southerners. 

Good People Brewing Company seemed like the perfect fit.  Good People describes the kind, humble, concerned, and respected folks all throughout the South, no matter if your speaking singularly or plurally. That is what we strive for here at Good People Brewing Company….to be good people. 

In September of 2007, we acquired our equipment and started getting our brewery put together. It was a long, frustrating, and tiring process….but it was flat worth every bit of it all.

So if you are looking for something made in small batches with high quality ingredients and pride, please give us a shot.

The Brewery
We brew on a two kettle, combi-tank and brew kettle, 20 bbl system manufactured by New World Systems. New World is now Premier Stainless and Rob and Alan are two of the best in the business.

We have three 20 bbl fermenters and one 20 bbl bright tank.

data.name: Built To Last Pilsner
data.description: Just as the name states, this Pilsner is brewed to withstand the myriad of beer consumers. Respected by beer geeks, and loved by ‘light’ beer drinkers, this lager caters to all pallets. Patience must be exercised during this delicate brewing process which takes over double the time as a typical ale. Only the finest Noble hops are used to balance the slightly grainy malt profile. Lager yeast creates a crisp, dry finish that leaves your pallet refreshed and wanting more.

data.name: Bushwick Pilsner
data.description: The return of the style that made Bushwick famous. Old school, dry and refreshing, Bushwick Pilsner is a ballpark-ready brew. Your granddad would love this beer.

breweries.name: Braven Brewing Company
breweries.description: Braven Brewing Company, founded in 2013 by Marshall S. Thompson and Eric Feldman, is located in the historic Bushwick neighborhood of Brooklyn. Focused on creating crisp, perfectly balanced ales and lagers, Braven’s beers are the ideal addition to the party, day or night. Braven takes pride in being an active member of the Bushwick community and is excited to help revive Brooklyn as one of America’s top brewing capitals.

data.name: Calhoun Claw Pilsener
data.description: Inspired by the classic lagers of Bohemia, our Pilsener has a crisp body balanced by a quick snap of refreshing bitterness. Brewed with a blend of Czech and American hops, this beer is full of flavor but still easy drinking.

breweries.name: Mikkeller
breweries.description:
The story of Mikkeller is the story of two homebrewers that in a few years went from hobby brewing in the kitchen to national and international recognition.

Since the summer of 2007, Mikkel Borg Bjergsø, has run Mikkeller on his own. Mikkel is a gipsy-brewer, who brews at different breweries in Denmark, around Europe and the United States.

data.name: Camel Toad Pils
data.description: The "Toad" is a German style pilsner with an American twist. We combine Pilsner, Munich and Vienna malts with U.S. hop variants and finish the process by dry-hopping the fermenting wort. This brew will appeal to light beer and lager fans.

data.name: Capitol Light
data.description: Our American-style Pilsener is brewed with Bohemian Pilsner Malt and a bit of American corn to lighten the body. We hopped this up with heavy doses of American and Czech Saaz to give this beer enough hope bite and flavor without crushing your desire for a second one.

Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

breweries.name: C.H. Evans Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Evans family was in the commercial brewing business for three generations. The original brewery was built in Hudson, NY in 1786. It continued production until prohibition in 1920. Its award winning ales were well known in the Northeast and were even exported to England and France. Production levels peaked in 1915 when 65,000 barrels of beer were produced at the Hudson Facility.

The brewery bottled its own beer in Hudson at one of the country’s earliest bottling facilities (1889) and later at a plant in New York City. The family also malted much of their own grain in their malt houses at the Hudson facility. Neil Evans revives this rich heritage here at the Albany Pump Station. Surviving C.H. Evans Brewing Company memorabilia is displayed in the new facility, as well as pictures of the pump station as it appeared at the turn of the century.

data.name: Captain Jack’s 44 Pilsner
data.description: Dedicated in memory of Captain Jack McDonald and his Patrol Squadron 44, this traditional pilsner is brewed to honor all WWII veterans. A simple beer, using a majority of pilsen malt and traditional lager yeast provides a very crisp mouthfeel with a smooth sweet finish made to reflect the popular beer of choice of the greatest

breweries.name: Belle Isle Restaurant and Brewing Co
breweries.description: The Belle Isle Restaurant & Brewery, located in the heart of Northwest Oklahoma City, is a favorite for lunch, dinner and entertainment. Enjoy a menu of pastas, burgers, pizzas, and more. Then there's the Beer! We at the Belle Isle Brewery are proud to create the finest handcrafted beer available, using the best ingredients and strict German Brewing rules. We've developed an excellent selection of beers now available for take out. Our pub features a daily happy hour and live music.

data.name: Cardinal Sin
data.description: When you are seeking a light bodied but flavorful lager, look no further! We have the answer with a bright, filtered, brilliant golden Pilsner style beer. This special Pilsner has a European flavor profile which promises a slightly stronger taste, but a crisp, clean maltiness. A balanced Pilsner for all beer drinkers to enjoy.

breweries.name: The Lucky Monk
breweries.description:
A family-friendly restaurant featuring Prime beef burgers, thin-crust pizza, and craft-brewed beers, including 6 brewed on the premises.

When you name your restaurant after Trappist monks who've spent centuries perfecting their craft, you're serious about your beer. That's why we hired a master to craft our house brews, and why our beer list spans the globe. With everything from refreshing pilsners that match the lightness of our thin-crust pizza to dark, rich ales that stand up to our decadent burgers, you're certain to find a new favorite at The Lucky Monk. We're sure that our Prime beef burgers — served with hand-cut fries — will be the juiciest you've ever had. Our other house specialty, pizza, is crisp and generously topped with fresh ingredients. And we round out our menu with vibrant, flavorful salads; a handful of classic, satisfying American entrées; and some sweet surprises.

Whether you're settling in at our bar or relaxing with your friends and family in our comfortable dining room, our delicious food and drink and warm welcome are sure to elevate your soul.

data.name: Carl
data.description: Named after the man who brought modern day refrigeration techniques to Europe. Carl was aged at a cool temperature over a bed of hops.  With a sturdy white head this beer fills the nose with citrus, pine, and floral notes and has a clean refreshing finish. 8.5% abv

breweries.name: Olde Main Brewing Co.
breweries.description: At Olde Main Brewing Co. we believe, it's not about the next beer, it's about enjoying the one in your hand. That's why head brewer Jeff "Puff" Irvin and brewer "Big John" Rundall blend traditional brewing practices and modern techniques to craft fresh, full-flavored beers. Taste the true deliciosity at bars, restaurant, and retail stores across Iowa or at the Ames brewery and restaurant.

breweries.name: Florida Beer Company
breweries.description: Headquartered in beautiful Cape Canaveral, FL. Florida Beer Company is Florida's state of the art brewery. With 17 years of brewing tradition, Florida Beer Company produces some of Florida's finest craft beer from its new 60,000 sq.ft. facility. Locals and visitor's to Florida's East Coast can enjoy handcrafted favorites like Swamp Ape DIPA, Florida Lager, Devil's Triangle IPA and Sunshine State PILS.

breweries.name: Full Sail Brewing Company
breweries.description: Perched on a bluff in Hood River, Oregon, overlooking the mighty Columbia River’s epic wind and kite surfing and the snow-capped volcanic peaks of Mt. Hood, Full Sail is a true craft-brewing pioneer. Since 1987, Full Sail has been pouring pure Mt. Hood water, local ingredients and responsible processes into each and every pint. Full Sail’s brews and sustainable practices have garnered more than 300 national and international awards, including 150 gold medals and Beverage World‘s “Craft Brewer of the Year” distinction. From Full Sail Amber and IPA to Session Lager and bourbon barrel-aged beers, Full Sail consistently strives to brew complex, balanced and ridiculously tasty beers.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener

data.name: Champagne Velvet
data.description: Champagne Velvet is a Classic American Pilsner, reminiscent of what local beer tasted like before prohibition. The balance of corn and malted barley provides a golden straw color and subtle sweetness, reminding the drinker of a time when corn would be used to provide flavor and stability to beer. Cluster hops, the oldest variety grown in the United States, were used for bittering, and a late kettle addition of German Tettnang provides noble hop flavor and aroma. Grown in the southwest region of Germany where Anton Mayer was born before immigrating to the United States and taking over the Terre Haute Brewing Company, our choice of Tettnang hops are both a tribute to the man who would make Champagne Velvet’s original popularity possible while also adding a historically authentic ingredient to our recipe.

breweries.name: Upland Brewing Company
breweries.description: We’ve been brewing ales, lagers, and sours in Bloomington, Indiana since 1998. Many of our brews are unique twists on traditional recipes, while others are products of our own imaginations. We’re proud to say that several of our beers have brought home national and international medals and awards, but what we really care about is brewing the kinds of beer we like to drink, and providing a fresh local option to our communities. It never hurts to get a pat on the back, though! Along the way, we’ve made lots of friends and drank our unfair share of good beer, all while trying to do good in our communities and do well as a craft brewery.

data.name: Chicago Pilsner
data.description:
Totally sessionable, this bright, hop-forward Pilsener was first introduced in 1989 right here in Chicago. In a time when “craft beer” did not yet exist in Chicago and pure, flavorful beer was virtually unknown in the US aside from imports —and people thought “Reinheitsghebot” was something you said when someone sneezed— this beer caused quite a stir.

Today, we’ve painstakingly recreated Douglas Babcook’s original, ground-breaking recipe, right down to the exact hops and exclusive yeast strain. Its amber color, spicy hop-forward aroma, malty body, and creamy finish truly set this beer apart from all others.

The late beer critic Michael Jackson called this recipe, “The best pilsener I’ve ever tasted in America.”

We humbly agree.

Please share with your friends, and introduce them to the Baderbräu tradition.

data.name: Chicken Scratch
data.description: A crisp and refreshing traditional American Pilsner made from malted barley, locally grown corn and America's only native hop variety. The beer has a slight residual sweetness from the corn and a floral/herbal hop aroma. Chicken Scratch is light on the palate and flavorful.

breweries.name: Mikkeller
breweries.description:
The story of Mikkeller is the story of two homebrewers that in a few years went from hobby brewing in the kitchen to national and international recognition.

Since the summer of 2007, Mikkel Borg Bjergsø, has run Mikkeller on his own. Mikkel is a gipsy-brewer, who brews at different breweries in Denmark, around Europe and the United States.

breweries.name: Switchback Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in Burlington, Vermont, Switchback Brewing Company was founded in 2002 by a formally trained master brewer and his friend, the vision was to concentrate limited resources into making just a few beers to achieve the highest quality possible. The success of Switchback Ale beer has driven constant expansion for over 7 years and made the release of three Rotating Specials, Roasted Red Ale, Porter, and Slow-Fermented Brown Ale possible. Thank you for your support!

As in the beginning, Switchback continues to rely on word of mouth to increase sales, which have expanded into New York, New Hampshire, and Southern Maine. Switchback now brews several thousand barrels of beer each year, but its beer is only available on draught or in 1/2 and 1/6 barrel size kegs.

data.name: Classic American
data.description: This is our version of the beer your Grandfather drank. Prior to consolidation, American Pilsners were a thing of beauty, the brewers showcase of his talents. Sharing much of its character with its European cousin, the true point of difference of this style is the addition of corn, which lends a slight sweetness, yet not enough to overpower the crisp, herbal hop note. This is an extremely refreshing beer; light in color, crisp in body, and low in alcohol, with just the right balance of malt and hops.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: Classic American Pilsner
data.description: This lost beer style that was once a staple in the American beer landscape during the pre-Prohibition era was resurrected by an Ann Arborite named Jeff Renner years ago. It was originally the immigrant brewer’s version of a German Pilsner using American ingredients like 6-row barley and corn, and hops native to the US. We brew ours with advice and guidance from Renner and cold condition it for over two months before serving. Cold and crisp hardly begin to describe this delicious brew.

breweries.name: Cocoa Beach Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Cocoa Beach Brewing Company is a family owned and operated brewery and pub.  We are located in historic downtown Cocoa Beach on Atlantic Avenue (northbound Highway A1A) between 1st Street North and 2nd Street North.  We are proud to be located in one of the oldest buildings in world famous Cocoa Beach.  Built in the 1930s, our building was originally Navy housing for the Banana River Naval Air Station.  It has since been home to a number of commercial enterprises.

Our brewery consists of a custom designed and built 1.5 bbl Brewhouse and three 1.5 bbl stainless steel conical fermentation tanks.

data.name: CONDOR PILSNER
data.description: A traditional Unfiltered German Pilsner. Keller means cellar in German thus denoting that this beer is left unfiltered. This lager is fairly dry and was made with 100% German Pilsner malt and hopped with German Aurora and Czech Saaz. The Saaz gives this beer a slightly spicy aroma and a clean bitterness. German pilsners are hoppier than its American counterparts. (Bud, Miller, Coors etc.)

Located in Historic Downtown, the Front Street Brewery is Wilmington’s only Restaurant with its own Brewery. Our staff takes pride in offering fresh modern American cuisine, ranging from gourmet burgers to fine entrees and everything in between, at a reasonable price.

Front Street Brewery focuses on traditional beers as well as stretching the limits from time to time with various oak aged beers, sours and experimental styles throughout the year.

data.description: Shmaltz Brewing Company unveils a stunning spectacle: the delicate balance of 8 hops gracefully thrust into the inner sanctum of 4 luscious malts astonishing in depth, dazzling in mouthfeel. A scintillating brewing performance.

data.name: Craft Pilsner
data.description:
Almanac’s Craft Pilsner is a crisp, dry-hopped lager that provides a West Coast twist on the traditional German style. Citra, Mosaic, Simcoe, and Mandarina Bavaria hops provide a melon and citrus nose backed by 100% Pilsner malt. This beer is crushable, always begging for another sip and pairs well with sushi, outdoor grilling and tames spicy Thai and Mexican dishes.

Fresh Beer

Our Fresh Beer Series delivers the best in farm fresh beer. Big flavors, bold yeast characters and huge hop aromas reflect our rich California agricultural bounty. Every beer is brewed, packaged and shipped with an eye towards maximum freshness. All of our Fresh Beers are designed to pair with a wide variety of cuisine—so enjoy a pour of The Golden State’s most flavorful beer..

breweries.name: Lunacy Brewing
breweries.description: Lunacy Brewing Company is dedicated to bringing you the best quality and best tasting craft beers to your palate. We are crazy over beer, as crazy as a lunatic. With so many craft beers on the market today, you can bet that we have tried most of them. Some may call it indulgence, but we call it research. We are in the process of building our brewery and tasting room and we hope that you will be able to try our Lunacy IPA as well as some of our other craft beers soon. Keep visiting our website for more information.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Fri:  5:00pm - 10:00pm
Sat:  12:00pm - 8:00pm

We are available for private events! Contact us or come on by to learn more.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. Malt flavor and aroma are medium. This is a light-medium to medium-bodied beer. Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

breweries.name: Old Yale Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In the heart of BC ‘s Fraser Valley surrounded by pristine mountains, rivers, lakes and agriculture you will find Chilliwack, BC – a recreational paradise and home of Old Yale Brewing Co.  

The story of our name, Old Yale, originates from the Old Yale Wagon Road.  Built in 1875, it was the Fraser Valley’s first road link connecting all the communities from New Westminster to Yale.  All of us at Old Yale Brewing  believe that it’s the connections between  people and communities that bring us together much like the road itself. 

Whether it’s our Classic Old Yale Pale Ale, Seargeant’s IPA or nationally acclaimed Sasquatch Stout, we invite you to taste one of BC’s finest craft-brewed beers.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. Malt flavor and aroma are medium. This is a light-medium to medium-bodied beer. Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

breweries.name: NoDa Brewing Company
breweries.description:
NoDa Brewing Company opened its doors to the world on October 29, 2011 and is one of Charlotte’s newest home-grown microbrewery for beer lovers in the Carolinas! This unique production brewery in Charlotte’s NoDa neighborhood crafts small-batch premium beers, offering something for nearly every beer drinker. The North Davidson (NoDa) neighborhood is known as the creative center of Charlotte: as a natural extension of NoDa’s artistic spirit, there isn’t a better place for a microbrewery to call home.

NoDa Brewing is a 15 barrel brewery creating the highest quality beers for local restaurants and pubs, as well as our tap room.  Our beer styles will have a Northwestern feel, showcasing American Pale Ales, India Pale Ales, and Porters.  Our small size gives us the flexibility to introduce many unique and artistic recipes as well as our renditions of classic varieties such as Imperial Stouts, Wit beers, and Winter Warmers.  Our Head Brewer frequently traveled to Europe over the past couple years.  He has been fortunate to have experienced the wonderful beers that have historically defined many current craft beer styles.  As we pay homage to these great and historic beers, we’ll add an American Flair that will be embraced in the Carolinas and beyond.

breweries.name: Titletown Brewing
breweries.description: Titletown Brewing Co was founded in 1996 inside the historic Chicago Northwestern Train Depot in the heart of Green Bay, WI.  The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.

breweries.name: Blue Ridge Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Blue Ridge Brewing Co. is an established restaurant and brewery, offering 15 years of experience brewing only the finest of home brews and cooking an extraordinary array of unique dishes. Please, stop on by!

Born in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Greenville's Brew-Pub continues to pay homage to one simple creed, to provide our customers the very best we can! We're as proud of Chef Rich's House-Made Menu as we are of Jay's Freshly Crafted Brews!
